intro: Obione cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved obione, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Obione cuneata is often found in coastal and arid regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
